definition[0]: someone or something that is powerful and must be regarded seriously as a possible opponent, competitor, danger etc
example[0]: Barcelona will be a force to be reckoned with this season.
example[1]: The principal was certainly a woman to be reckoned with.
definition[1]: to not consider a possible problem when you are making plans
example[2]: I had not reckoned with the excitement in the popular press.
definition[2]: to have to deal with someone or something powerful
example[3]: Any invader would have the military might of NATO to reckon with.
